sentences: Viina ma enam ei võta, see on kindel kui aamen kirikus.
Mis isa ütles, see oli nagu aamen kirikus.
context: The word 'kirikus' in Estonian is used as an intensifier to express certainty or completeness. It derives from the phrase 'nagu aamen kirikus' (like amen in church), which signifies something that is unquestionably true or definite, just as 'amen' said in church represents absolute affirmation of truth.
